desc: PRKD1, a serine/threonine kinase, is mutated in salivary gland carcinomas.

The PRKD1 gene encodes the serine/threonine protein kinase D1, which is involved in a variety of cellular processes. PRKD1 is activated by diacylglycerol (DAG) and is able to phosphorylate EGFR, among other targets, leading to signaling suppression (PMID: 17703233, 10523301, 21209314). PRKD1 plays a role in apoptosis and NF-kB-mediated response to oxidative stress (PMID: 10764790, 12505989). PRKD1 has also been implicated in VEGF-induced angiogenesis in endothelial cells (PMID: 18332134) and in the KRAS-mediated methylator phenotype of colorectal cancers (PMID: 24623306). The PRKD1 gene is mutated in cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas and salivary gland adenocarcinomas (PMID: 25240283, 25303977). Small molecule inhibitors against PRKD1 and other protein kinase D isoforms are available (PMID: 20442301).
